subject: "Sunday Morning" bringing the commute to your screen
body:
CBSNews.com












  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video 

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday Morning | Face The Nation 






May 25, 2007
Can you imagine anything worse on a 
      Memorial Day weekend than to be stuck in traffic?
That’s exactly what’s in store 
      for you this Sunday 
      Morning, as our Cover Story examines the commute -- the many ways we get to work or, more 
      accurately, try to get to 
      work.  Correspondent Nancy Cordes is behind the wheel.

On 
      this first weekend of summer, our Bill Flanagan dials up some of 
      the tunes we’ll be humming along to.

We’ll 
      also be visiting a collection of some of the world’s most beautiful 
      classic streamlined cars -- all 
      in mint condition!

And, while we're on the subject of 
      classic, our Mark Phillips will be sending us a Postcard from 
      London on the fire on the historic ship Cutty Sark.
Correspondent Rita Braver 
      catches up with Kevin Costner on a golf course in South Carolina. 
      We’ll check out some classic photographs from the files of the Associated 
      Press.

And Correspondent Kimberly 
      Dozier – grievously injured one year ago while covering the fighting in 
      Iraq – marks her return to 
      television with a report on the unique burden women injured in combat 
      endure.

Those 
      stories, and more, coming up on a Memorial Day weekend edition of 
      Sunday Morning.

Listen for our trumpet!
